00014 class Controls
00015 {

00020   int    getNumReserve                   () const throw() { return OBJECT_RESERVE_SIZE; }

00023   int    getMaxSection                   () const throw() { return MAX_SECTION; }
00024   int    getPrintDetailedInfo            () const throw() { return PRINT_DETAILED_INFO; }
00025   int    getReturnRawContourPoints       () const throw() { return RETURN_RAW_CONTOUR_POINTS; }

00027   int    getPtPerContourThreshold        () const throw() { return MIN_PT_PER_CONTOUR_THRESHOLD; }

00029   int    getMaxNumMoveAttempts           () const throw() { return SIM_ANNEAL_MAX_NUM_MOVE_ATTEMPTS; }

00036   double getHighTemp                     () const throw() { return SIM_ANNEAL_HIGH_TEMP; }
00037   double getTempScale                    () const throw() { return SIM_ANNEAL_TEMP_SCALE; }

00055 private:
00056   static Controls * only_one;
00057   Controls                (void);
00058   Controls                (Controls const &);
00059   Controls & operator =   (Controls const &);
00060 
00061   // accelerates program execution by pre-allocating memory
00062   // set OBJECT_RESERVE_SIZE equal to number of objects to be reconstructed
00063   // e.g. if reconstructing two dendrites and three axons, then set to five
00064   // OBJECT_RESERVE_SIZE > 0
00065   int OBJECT_RESERVE_SIZE;
00066 
00067   // if nonzero, then contour_tiler will be instructed to cap the meshes
00068   // at min and max z sections.
00069   // if zero, then do nothing. meshes will be left open at min and max z.
00070   int CAPPING_FLAG;
00071 
00072   // the range of sections to be analyzed
00073   int MIN_SECTION;
00074   int MAX_SECTION;
00075 
00076   // if nonzero, then print raw_points, s parameter values, etc to log files
00077   // if zero, then do nothing
00078   int PRINT_DETAILED_INFO;
00079 
00080   // if nonzero, then return input contour points unadulterated
00081   // if zero then fit splines to contour points and resample
00082   int RETURN_RAW_CONTOUR_POINTS;
00083 
00084   // if nonzero, then return input contour points
00085   // linearly interpolated to satisfy minimum and
00086   // maximum sample interval constraints.
00087   // if zero then fit splines to contour points and resample
00088   int RETURN_INTERPOLATED_RAW_POINTS;
00089 
00090   // number of points per contour
00091   // below which contours will be ignored and not processed
00092   // Contours with fewer than MIN_PT_PER_CONTOUR_THRESHOLD
00093   // output sample points will be omitted from output data
00094   // files and statistics.
00095   // MIN_PT_PER_CONTOUR_THRESHOLD=0 implies that all contours are included.
00096   // MIN_PT_PER_CONTOUR_THRESHOLD=3 screens out all contours
00097   // with fewer than 3 ouput sample points there by insuring that output contours
00098   // will not generate errors by contour_tiler.
00099   int MIN_PT_PER_CONTOUR_THRESHOLD;
00100 
00101   // Aside: Contours are fit by cubic splines. The cubic splines are sampled.
00102   //        The location on the splines of the samples is determined by
00103   //        simulated annealing.
00104 
00105   // Desired number of successful moves per sample per annealing iteration.
00106   // An annealing iteration is completed when the number of successful sample moves
00107   // equals SIM_ANNEAL_MOVES_PER_ITERATION * number of samples in contour.
00108   // The system is not frozen and annealing continues with another iteration
00109   // at lower temperature.
00110   int SIM_ANNEAL_MOVES_PER_ITERATION;
00111 
00112   // Max number of attempted moves per sample per annealing iteration.
00113   // An annealing iteration is aborted when the number of attempted sample moves
00114   // equals SIM_ANNEAL_MAX_NUM_MOVE_ATTEMPTS * number of samples in contour.
00115   // Three aborted iterations in a row indicates that the contour samples
00116   // are frozen and simulated annealing is complete.
00117   // SIM_ANNEAL_MAX_NUM_MOVE_ATTEMPTS > SIM_ANNEAL_MOVES_PER_ITERATION
00118   int SIM_ANNEAL_MAX_NUM_MOVE_ATTEMPTS;
00119 
00120   // Cubic spline length is determined by numerical integration
00121   // where the function to be integrated is broken into 
00122   // SIM_ANNEAL_INTEGRATION_STEP-1 pieces.
00123   // SIM_ANNEAL_INTEGRATION_STEP must be odd and >= 3
00124   // SIM_ANNEAL_INTEGRATION_STEP_FACTOR is inverse of SIM_ANNEAL_INTEGRATION_STEP-1
00125   int SIM_ANNEAL_INTEGRATION_STEP;
00126   double SIM_ANNEAL_INTEGRATION_STEP_FACTOR;
00127 
00128   // If the deviation between sampled cubic spline points and linearly
00129   // interpolated input contour points is larger than DEVIATION_THRESHOLD
00130   // then control points are duplicated no more than MAX_DEVIATION_ADJUSTMENTS
00131   // times to reduce the deviation.
00132   int MAX_DEVIATION_ADJUSTMENTS;
00133 
00134   // The number N of contour samples will be calculated as follows.
00135   // Let L = contour length
00136   //     N_min = L/MAX_SAMPLE_INTERVAL
00137   //     N_max = L/MIN_SAMPLE_INTERVAL
00138   // N = N_min + (N_max-N_min)*ADDITIONAL_POINTS_FACTOR
00139   // where 0 <= ADDITIONAL_POINTS_FACTOR <= 1
00140   double ADDITIONAL_POINTS_FACTOR;
00141 
00142   // Simulated annealing progresses from an initial high temp
00143   // (SIM_ANNEAL_HIGH_TEMP) to a very low temperature.
00144   // SIM_ANNEAL_HIGH_TEMP>0
00145   double SIM_ANNEAL_HIGH_TEMP; 
00146 
00147   // After each iteration of simulated annealing the temperature
00148   // of the system is lowered by multiplying the old temperature
00149   // by SIM_ANNEAL_TEMP_SCALE. 0<SIM_ANNEAL_TEMP_SCALE<1
00150   double SIM_ANNEAL_TEMP_SCALE; 
00151 
00152   // Inverse of boltzman constant.
00153   double SIM_ANNEAL_BOLTZMAN; 
00154 
00155   // A sample point contributes to energy in a manner proportional
00156   // to SIM_ANNEAL_CURVATURE_ENERGY_GAIN and inversely proportional
00157   // to curvature.
00158   double SIM_ANNEAL_CURVATURE_ENERGY_GAIN;
00159 
00160   // A sample point contributes to energy in a manner inversely proportional
00161   // to curvature to the SIM_ANNEAL_CURVATURE_ENERGY_EXPONENT power.
00162   int SIM_ANNEAL_CURVATURE_ENERGY_EXPONENT;
00163 
00164   // A sample point contributes to energy in a manner proportional
00165   // to SIM_ANNEAL_PROXIMITY_ENERGY_GAIN and distance between samples.
00166   double SIM_ANNEAL_PROXIMITY_ENERGY_GAIN;
00167 
00168   // A sample point contributes to energy in a manner proportional to distance
00169   // between samples to the SIM_ANNEAL_PROXIMITY_ENERGY_EXPONENT power.
00170   int SIM_ANNEAL_PROXIMITY_ENERGY_EXPONENT;
00171 
00172   // Randomly picked samples are shifted a random amount during simulated
00173   // annealing. The distribution of shifts is gaussian with a mean
00174   // of SIM_ANNEAL_MEAN_AMPLITUDE_NOISE. Position along the cubic splines
00175   // is described a single parameter to which the stochastic perturbation
00176   // is applied.
00177   double SIM_ANNEAL_MEAN_AMPLITUDE_NOISE;
00178 
00179   // If radius of curvature of spline is determined to be infinite,
00180   // i.e. a straight line,  then radius of curvature is set
00181   // to MAXIMUM_RADIUS_OF_CURVATURE.
00182   double MAXIMUM_RADIUS_OF_CURVATURE;
00183 
00184   // thickness of each section (assumed uniform across sections)
00185   // units [same as input data]
00186   double SECTION_THICKNESS;
00187 
00188   // Scaling factor of output contour positions. Output data
00189   // will be scaled by OUTPUT_SCALE_FACTOR before being written to file.
00190   double OUTPUT_SCALE_FACTOR;
00191 
00192   // Sampled spline points are not allowed to deviated from
00193   // input contour points by more than DEVIATION_THRESHOLD.
00194   double DEVIATION_THRESHOLD;
00195 
00196   // Value below which a floating point number is considered to be zero.
00197   double EPSILON;
00198 
00199   // The cubic spline path distance between samples
00200   // will not exceed MAX_SAMPLE_INTERVAL.
00201   double MAX_SAMPLE_INTERVAL;
00202 
00203   // The cubic spline path distance between samples
00204   // will not be less tha MIN_SAMPLE_INTERVAL.
00205   double MIN_SAMPLE_INTERVAL;
00206 
00207   // Directory containing input contours.
00208   std::string INPUT_DIR;
00209 
00210   // Directory to which output data will be written.
00211   std::string OUTPUT_DIR;
00212 
00213   // The input contours will be read from
00214   // 'INPUT_DIR/PREFIX.MIN_SECTION' to
00215   // 'INPUT_DIR/PREFIX.MAX_SECTION'
00216   std::string PREFIX;
00217 
00218   // Collection of contour names that are to be ignored and not processed.
00219   std::vector<std::string> IGNORED_CONTOURS;
00220 
00221   // Name of bash script written to output directory
00222   // which contains commands to tile output contours and convert
00223   // resulting meshes to Hughes Hoppe mesh format.
00224   std::string OUTPUT_SCRIPT;
00225 
00226   // Objects with intermediate empty sections (thereby
00227   // requiring multiple tiling steps) will have name
00228   // and associated output files appended with
00229   // MULTI_PART_SUFFIX plus incremented index.
00230   std::string MULTI_PART_SUFFIX;
00231 
00232 public:
00233 
00237   void validate (void)
00238   {
00239     // number of integration steps must be even and greater than 1.
00240     assert(SIM_ANNEAL_INTEGRATION_STEP>1);
00241     assert(!(SIM_ANNEAL_INTEGRATION_STEP%2));
00242     // mutually exclusive modes
00243     assert(!(RETURN_RAW_CONTOUR_POINTS && RETURN_INTERPOLATED_RAW_POINTS));
00244     // factor between 0 and 1
00245     assert(ADDITIONAL_POINTS_FACTOR>=0.0);
00246     assert(ADDITIONAL_POINTS_FACTOR<=1.0);
00247     // max sample interval greater than or equal to min
00248     assert(MAX_SAMPLE_INTERVAL>=0.0);
00249     assert(MIN_SAMPLE_INTERVAL>=0.0);
00250     assert(MAX_SAMPLE_INTERVAL>=MIN_SAMPLE_INTERVAL);
00251     // section thickness must be positive and nonzero
00252     assert(SECTION_THICKNESS>0.0);
00253     // sections must be positive
00254     assert(MIN_SECTION>=0);
00255     assert(MAX_SECTION>=0);
00256     // simulated annealing must be positive and nonzero
00257     assert(SIM_ANNEAL_HIGH_TEMP>0.0);
00258     // simulated annealing temp scaling must be between 0 and 1
00259     assert(SIM_ANNEAL_TEMP_SCALE>0.0);
00260     assert(SIM_ANNEAL_TEMP_SCALE<1.0);
00261     // gains must be positive
00262     assert(SIM_ANNEAL_CURVATURE_ENERGY_GAIN>=0.0);
00263     assert(SIM_ANNEAL_PROXIMITY_ENERGY_GAIN>=0.0);
00264     // exponents must be positive and nonzero
00265     assert(SIM_ANNEAL_CURVATURE_ENERGY_EXPONENT>0);
00266     assert(SIM_ANNEAL_PROXIMITY_ENERGY_EXPONENT>0);
00267     // mean of path parameter displacement distribution must be positive and nonzero
00268     assert(SIM_ANNEAL_MEAN_AMPLITUDE_NOISE>0.0);
00269     // maximum radius of curvature must be positive and nonzero
00270     assert(MAXIMUM_RADIUS_OF_CURVATURE>0.0);
00271     // output scaling factor must be nonzero
00272     assert(OUTPUT_SCALE_FACTOR!=0.0);
00273     // threshold for sample point deviation to original contour must be positive and nonzero
00274     //assert(DEVIATION_THRESHOLD>0.0);
00275     // epsilon must be positive and nonzero
00276     assert(EPSILON>0.0);
00277   }
00278 
00284   bool contourIsIgnored (char const * const name) const
00285   {
00286     for (std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator i=IGNORED_CONTOURS.begin();i!=IGNORED_CONTOURS.end();i++)
00287     {
00288       if (!strcmp((*i).c_str(),name)) return true;
00289     }
00290     return false;
00291   }
00292 
00298   std::string d2str (double const & num) const
00299   {
00300     char file[1024];
00301     sprintf(file,"%.15g",num);
00302     return std::string(file);
00303   }
00304 
00310   std::string i2str (int const & num) const
00311   {
00312     char file[1024];
00313     sprintf(file,"%i",num);
00314     return std::string(file);
00315   }
00316 
00322   std::string processDir (char * ptr) const
00323   {
00324     std::string pathname = ptr;
00325     if (pathname.find_last_of('/')==std::string::npos)
00326     {
00327       pathname.push_back('/');
00328       return pathname;
00329     }
00330     size_t pos = pathname.find_last_of('/');
00331     if ((pos+1)==pathname.size())
00332     {
00333       return pathname;
00334     }
00335     else
00336     {
00337       pathname.push_back('/');
00338       return pathname;
00339     }
00340   }
